title: Do you think a university student can study and work at the same time? - Quora

response.answer_text: The reality is that a lot of university students study and work at the same time. I did it when I was in college in the U.S. It was stressful at times, but I needed to support myself. All of my friends at school had jobs, too. It’s normal for American university students. I know this isn’t universal, though. Now I live in China, where it seems to be unusual for serious university students to work or even date. I’ve met quite a few people here who just graduated from college, but never had any kind of work experience unless it was just for the summer.

It depends on the major being studied. An engineering student may find working and studying more complicated than a banking student may find. Many majors have a pretty load of studies on students, where they barely manage to finish all their assignments before deadlines. Other majors are piece of cakes, where the student can easily work and study. I am studying architecture and I am suffering so much. But at the end it is worth it. There are some quick easy solutions: Try to work between terms/semestersTry to find a job that pays you per hourGood luck!

I did so from 2013 to 2018. I didn't study full-time though, I usually did 1/3 or 2/3 of a regular study load, while working full time. It was doable, but it did mean having less spare time for fun things. One guy I studied with managed to do a full study load while also working full time, but he was exceptionally bright.

It depends on the course you have opted or the university in which you are. like for some courses you have to make extra efforts ……but if you are good in time management then of course you can balance your work and study Like one of my friend who is in second year of her graduation ,she gives tuition at home and also attends college at regular basis all i can say is that it is all up to you.
